Yii Framework v2.0.0-dev Class Reference

Class yii\rbac\PhpManager

All Classes | Properties | Methods
Inheritanceyii\rbac\PhpManager » yii\rbac\Manager » yii\base\Component » yii\base\Object
Implementsyii\base\Arrayable
Available since version2.0
Source Code
PhpManager represents an authorization manager that stores authorization information in terms of a PHP script file.

The authorization data will be saved to and loaded from a file specified by $authFile, which defaults to 'protected/data/rbac.php'.

PhpManager is mainly suitable for authorization data that is not too big (for example, the authorization data for a personal blog system). Use yii\rbac\DbManager for more complex authorization data.

Property Details

$authFile property
string $authFile = '@app/data/rbac.php'

The path of the PHP script that contains the authorization data. This can be either a file path or a path alias to the file. Make sure this file is writable by the Web server process if the authorization needs to be changed online.

See Also

  • loadFromFile()
  • saveToFile()

Method Details

init() method
void init( )

Initializes the application component.

This method overrides parent implementation by loading the authorization data from PHP script.

checkAccess() method
boolean checkAccess( $userId, $itemName, $params = [] )
$userId mixed The user ID. This can be either an integer or a string representing
$itemName string The name of the operation that need access check the unique identifier of a user. See \yii\rbac\User::id.
$params array Name-value pairs that would be passed to biz rules associated with the tasks and roles assigned to the user. A param with name 'userId' is added to this array, which holds the value of $userId.
return boolean whether the operations can be performed by the user.

Performs access check for the specified user.

createItem() method
yii\rbac\Item createItem( $name, $type, $description = '', $bizRule = null, $data = null )
$name string The item name. This must be a unique identifier.
$type integer The item type (0: operation, 1: task, 2: role).
$description string Description of the item
$bizRule string Business rule associated with the item. This is a piece of PHP code that will be executed when checkAccess() is called for the item.
$data mixed Additional data associated with the item.
return yii\rbac\Item the authorization item
throws yii\base\Exception if an item with the same name already exists

Creates an authorization item.

An authorization item represents an action permission (e.g. creating a post). It has three types: operation, task and role. Authorization items form a hierarchy. Higher level items inheirt permissions representing by lower level items.

removeItem() method
boolean removeItem( $name )
$name string The name of the item to be removed
return boolean whether the item exists in the storage and has been removed

Removes the specified authorization item.

getItems() method
yii\rbac\Item[] getItems( $userId = null, $type = null )
$userId mixed The user ID. Defaults to null, meaning returning all items even if they are not assigned to a user.
$type integer The item type (0: operation, 1: task, 2: role). Defaults to null, meaning returning all items regardless of their type.
return yii\rbac\Item[] the authorization items of the specific type.

Returns the authorization items of the specific type and user.

getItem() method
yii\rbac\Item getItem( $name )
$name string The name of the item
return yii\rbac\Item the authorization item. Null if the item cannot be found.

Returns the authorization item with the specified name.

saveItem() method
void saveItem( $item, $oldName = null )
$item yii\rbac\Item The item to be saved.
$oldName string The old item name. If null, it means the item name is not changed.
throws yii\base\InvalidParamException if an item with the same name already taken

Saves an authorization item to persistent storage.

addItemChild() method
boolean addItemChild( $itemName, $childName )
$itemName string The parent item name
$childName string The child item name
return boolean whether the item is added successfully
throws yii\base\Exception if either parent or child doesn't exist.
throws yii\base\InvalidCallException if item already has a child with $itemName or if a loop has been detected.

Adds an item as a child of another item.

removeItemChild() method
boolean removeItemChild( $itemName, $childName )
$itemName string The parent item name
$childName string The child item name
return boolean whether the removal is successful

Removes a child from its parent.

Note, the child item is not deleted. Only the parent-child relationship is removed.

hasItemChild() method
boolean hasItemChild( $itemName, $childName )
$itemName string The parent item name
$childName string The child item name
return boolean whether the child exists

Returns a value indicating whether a child exists within a parent.

getItemChildren() method
yii\rbac\Item[] getItemChildren( $names )
$names mixed The parent item name. This can be either a string or an array. The latter represents a list of item names.
return yii\rbac\Item[] all child items of the parent

Returns the children of the specified item.

assign() method
yii\rbac\Assignment assign( $userId, $itemName, $bizRule = null, $data = null )
$userId mixed The user ID (see \yii\rbac\User::id)
$itemName string The item name
$bizRule string The business rule to be executed when checkAccess() is called for this particular authorization item.
$data mixed Additional data associated with this assignment
return yii\rbac\Assignment the authorization assignment information.
throws yii\base\InvalidParamException if the item does not exist or if the item has already been assigned to the user

Assigns an authorization item to a user.

return yii\rbac\Assignment the item assignment information. Null is returned if the item is not assigned to the user.

save() method
void save( )

Saves authorization data into persistent storage.

If any change is made to the authorization data, please make sure you call this method to save the changed data into persistent storage.

Loads authorization data.

$childName string The name of the child item that is to be added to the hierarchy
